few_shots.summary: People awkwardly avoid eye contact in elevators while pretending to read manuals
few_shots.output: Elevator etiquette rule #3: When forced to chat, always mention the weather... of the ventilation system. Because 'Lovely day!' sounds less fake when directed at metal walls.

few_shots.summary: Office workers pretend to ignore each other in elevators while subtly checking phones to avoid conversation
few_shots.output: Why do elevators have mirrors? So you can practice your 'How’s the weather?' face without committing to actual small talk. #FirstWorldProblems

few_shots.summary: People say 'going up?' in crowded elevators despite knowing destinations are obvious
few_shots.output: Elevator small talk’s greatest mystery: If we’re all going up, why does the question sound like an accusation? ‘Going up? Looks like your floor is stained glass now...’
